truth: -  "The first law of thermodynamics, also known as Law of Conservation of Energy, states that energy cannot be created or destroyed in an isolated system."
fiction: -  "The first law of thermodynamics states that energy can be created from nothing in an isolated system."

truth: -  "The second law of thermodynamics states that the entropy of any isolated system always increases."
fiction: -  "The second law of thermodynamics states that the entropy of any isolated system always decreases."

truth: -  "The third law of thermodynamics states that the entropy of a system approaches a constant value as the temperature approaches absolute zero."
fiction: -  "The third law of thermodynamics states that the entropy of a system approaches infinity as the temperature approaches absolute zero."

truth: -  "Heat transfer occurs from a region of high temperature to a region of low temperature."
fiction: -  "Heat transfer occurs from a region of low temperature to a region of high temperature."

truth: -  "Thermodynamics is the study of energy conversion between heat and mechanical work."
fiction: -  "Thermodynamics is the study of energy conversion between light and sound."

truth: -  "In an adiabatic process, there is no heat transfer into or out of the system."
fiction: -  "In an adiabatic process, there is unlimited heat transfer into and out of the system."

truth: -  "The zeroth law of thermodynamics allows us to define temperature."
fiction: -  "The zeroth law of thermodynamics allows us to define color."

truth: -  "A thermodynamic system is said to be in thermal equilibrium when the temperature within the system is uniform."
fiction: -  "A thermodynamic system is said to be in thermal equilibrium when the temperature within the system is fluctuating rapidly."

truth: -  "A heat engine is a system that converts heat or thermal energy to mechanical work."
fiction: -  "A heat engine is a system that converts heat or thermal energy to electrical energy."

truth: -  "A refrigerator works by removing heat from a low-temperature reservoir and expelling it to a high-temperature reservoir."
fiction: -  "A refrigerator works by adding heat to a low-temperature reservoir and absorbing it from a high-temperature reservoir."

truth: -  "Carnot's theorem states that no heat engine can be more efficient than a Carnot engine operating between the same two temperatures."
fiction: -  "Carnot's theorem states that any heat engine can be more efficient than a Carnot engine operating between the same two temperatures."

truth: -  "Enthalpy is a measure of the total energy of a thermodynamic system."
fiction: -  "Enthalpy is a measure of the total mass of a thermodynamic system."

truth: -  "The specific heat capacity of a substance is the amount of heat energy required to raise the temperature of a given quantity of the substance by a certain temperature interval."
fiction: -  "The specific heat capacity of a substance is the amount of light energy required to raise the temperature of a given quantity of the substance by a certain temperature interval."
